title: Terrible server routing past few patches
body: In the past couple of patches, I've noticed my ping rise up to 50, while hearing from friends, and seeing on streams that the west coasts ping has gotten better. My Ping currently sits at 50, while players/friends I know in california are sitting on 50 ping as well, some sitting in the upper 50s. How is it possible? In terms of distance to chicago. I currently sit at about 550~ Miles away from the servers, and santa monica is sitting roughly triple that at 1750 miles. I have another friend who lives in toronto and gets roughly 30 ping, sitting at roughly 450 miles away. I understand that my packets may be taking an unfavorable bounce to different cities, but I don't see how my ping should be even close to california's ping. Whats up with that? Id love to be able to understand whats going on. Ive also confirmed with IRL friends that their ping also hovers 50 same as me. ISP: TWC , Western NY

replies.body:
Your latency to a server is largely determined by the specific network routing your connection takes to that server. As you can imagine, your ISP and the companies they partner with are under control of this routing, so it's something you'll most likely have to inquire about with them.

We can take an in-depth look at your route if you run a traceroute using [WinMTR.](http://winmtr.net/) After opening the app, plug in **104.160.131.1** for the focus address, then start the trace. After it's run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.

Let me know if you have any issues completing this.

> [{quoted}](name=Targons Blade,realm=NA,application-id=osqw6G4M,discussion-id=IN73JozA,comment-id=0000,timestamp=2016-10-25T03:21:44.488+0000)
>
> Your latency to a server is largely determined by the specific network routing your connection takes to that server. As you can imagine, your ISP and the companies they partner with are under control of this routing, so it's something you'll most likely have to inquire about with them.
> 
> We can take an in-depth look at your route if you run a traceroute using [WinMTR.](http://winmtr.net/) After opening the app, plug in **104.160.131.1** for the focus address, then start the trace. After it's run for 5 minutes, export the results as text and paste them in a reply to me.
> 
> Let me know if you have any issues completing this.

I appreciate your reply, and I have friends with different ISP (Greenlight networks) and they have similar pings, which is why I was wondering what was going on as the distance to ping ratio seemed high. Heres the results




|------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------|
|                                      WinMTR statistics                                   |
|                       Host              -   %  | Sent | Recv | Best | Avrg | Wrst | Last |
|------------------------------------------------|------|------|------|------|------|------|
|                             192.168.0.1 -    0 |  309 |  309 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |
|                   No response from host -  100 |   61 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |    0 |
|  tge0-0-56.rochnyeq01h.northeast.rr.com -    0 |  309 |  309 |   10 |   65 |  518 |   23 |
|      agg49.hnrtnyaf02r.northeast.rr.com -    1 |  305 |  304 |   12 |   14 |   24 |   15 |
|       be28.albynyyf01r.northeast.rr.com -    0 |  309 |  309 |   18 |   22 |   29 |   23 |
|bu-ether46.nycmny837aw-bcr00.tbone.rr.com -    0 |  309 |  309 |   27 |   33 |   45 |   30 |
|            0.ae1.pr1.nyc20.tbone.rr.com -    0 |  309 |  309 |   26 |   29 |   85 |   29 |
|                           24.27.236.129 -    0 |  309 |  309 |   26 |   28 |   35 |   29 |
|                          104.160.132.35 -    0 |  309 |  309 |   26 |   28 |   33 |   30 |
|          ae31-br01.chi01.riotdirect.net -    0 |  309 |  309 |   43 |   45 |   52 |   45 |
|                           104.160.131.1 -    0 |  309 |  309 |   42 |   45 |   52 |   46 |
|________________________________________________|______|______|______|______|______|______|
   WinMTR v0.92 GPL V2 by Appnor MSP - Fully Managed Hosting & Cloud Provider

Your traceroute reveals a 518ms spike in your latency on the first hop outside of your network at the following node: 
>**tge0-0-56.rochnyeq01h.northeast.rr.com**

____
Your latency then continues to be unstable as it hits a low of 24ms and then jumps up to 85ms shortly before hitting our servers. It seems this is occurring on Roadrunner's network prior to reaching our servers. I strongly suggest reaching out to a tier 2 tech at your ISP and providing them this traceroute so they have complete context on the issue.
____
Let me know if you have any other questions
